nodes.bodyText:
Use case:
Then number of visible elements found by `...` is equal to `3`

There are 4 elements by locator, and only 3 of them are visible, what will the step result be? I assume failure
nodes.diffHunk: @@ -315,6 +317,25 @@ public void clickOnAllElements(SearchAttributes locator) .forEach(e -> mouseActions.click(e)); } + /** + * Verifies elements' located by locator state. + * Where state one of: ENABLED/DISABLED, SELECTED/NOT_SELECTED, VISIBLE/NOT_VISIBLE + * @param state Desired state of an element + * @param locator Locator to locate element + * @param comparisonRule The rule to compare values + * (Possible values: LESS_THAN, LESS_THAN_OR_EQUAL_TO, GREATER_THAN, GREATER_THAN_OR_EQUAL_TO, + * EQUAL_TO) + * @param quantity Desired amount of elements + */ + @Then("number of $state elements found by `$locator` is $comparisonRule `$quantity`") + public void doesElementsNumberInStateExists(State state, SearchAttributes locator, ComparisonRule comparisonRule, + int quantity) + { + String description = "Element is " + state; + thePageContainsQuantityElements(locator, comparisonRule, quantity) + .forEach(e -> baseValidations.assertElementState(description, state, e));

nodes.bodyText:
Yep as stated - equal to 3 visible elements expected but got 4: 3 visible, and 1 invisible.

Fail condition check
Fail visibility check
nodes.diffHunk: @@ -315,6 +317,25 @@ public void clickOnAllElements(SearchAttributes locator) .forEach(e -> mouseActions.click(e)); } + /** + * Verifies elements' located by locator state. + * Where state one of: ENABLED/DISABLED, SELECTED/NOT_SELECTED, VISIBLE/NOT_VISIBLE + * @param state Desired state of an element + * @param locator Locator to locate element + * @param comparisonRule The rule to compare values + * (Possible values: LESS_THAN, LESS_THAN_OR_EQUAL_TO, GREATER_THAN, GREATER_THAN_OR_EQUAL_TO, + * EQUAL_TO) + * @param quantity Desired amount of elements + */ + @Then("number of $state elements found by `$locator` is $comparisonRule `$quantity`") + public void doesElementsNumberInStateExists(State state, SearchAttributes locator, ComparisonRule comparisonRule, + int quantity) + { + String description = "Element is " + state; + thePageContainsQuantityElements(locator, comparisonRule, quantity) + .forEach(e -> baseValidations.assertElementState(description, state, e));

@@ -0,0 +1,190 @@
+= Comparison rule
+
+== Description
+
+Describes elements locator. Should match regular expression: `(?:By\\.)?([a-zA-Z]+)\\((.+?)\\):?([a-zA-Z]*)?`
+
+== Syntax
+
+----
+By.<locatorType>(<locatorValue>):<visibility>->filter.<filterType>(<filterValue>)
+----
+
+[IMPORTANT]
+
+By. prefix is an optional.
